channel.title: recontruction on twistors105

item.title: effect algebra
item.description: effect algebra An effect algebra is a set $E$ satisfying the following axioms [@plavalaGeneralProbabilisticTheories2023; @gudder2002; @vandewetering2019]: there exists a symmetric binary relation $\perp$ on $E$, there exists a binary operation $a \perp b \xmapsto{\oplus} a \oplus b$, if $a \perp b$ then $a \oplus b = b \oplus a$, if $a \perp b$ and $(a \oplus b) \perp c$ then $b \perp c$ and $a \perp (b \oplus c)$, if $a \perp b$ and $(a \oplus b) \perp c$ then $a \oplus (b \oplus c) = (a \oplus b) \oplus c$, there exists $1 \in E$ such that $\forall a \in E$ there exists a unique $a' \in E$ with $a \perp a'$ and $a \oplus a' = 1$, and if $a \perp 1$ then $a = 0$.
